author: Kathleen Donaway
text: 'Great brunch option with friends! The $25 brunch portions were solid and the food and drinks were flavorful. We tried the steak & eggs
column5: french toast
column6: roadkill platter
column7: and chicken & waffles and everything was fantastic!'

author: Melody Ann Carey
text: "Great for brunch. Good food and good Bloody Mary's. Fun atmosphere. Great service."

author: Andrew Cho
text: 'Wednesdays they have $5 wings
column5: wine
column6: whiskey'

author: Gregory Gioia
text: 'Really like this place good food nice beer selection'

author: Nil Cor
text: 'Brunch is always awesome in this place. I have been going here for a few years. When I bring a friend they end up loving this place as well.'

author: Nicole
text: 'My boyfriend and I have come here many times. We enjoy the food
column5: drinks and the ambiance outside. However
column6: our last visit wasn\'t so enjoyable. We made a reservation for 4
column7: my boyfriend
column8: myself and his grandparents for outside. As we arrived
column9: we realized there were no seats outside that were available. My boyfriend spoke to the hostess (or she may have been the manager
column10: I\'m not sure) who let us know our table was taken by a random group of people who just decided to sit down there. We were disappointed by this
column11: especially due to her rude and dismissive attitude. I went inside and spoke to her
column12: she told me "we don\'t do reservations outside" when we requested this over the phone. I asked politely if there was any way we could possibly still sit outside as there was a party of 2 sitting at a 4 person table and there was an open 2 person table. She responded "I\'m not going to tell them to move." We decided to sit inside only to see that there were only high-top tables. Normally we wouldn\'t care but my boyfriend\'s grandparents are older and these weren\'t the most convenient for them. I kindly again asked the hostess if there\'s anything she can do to accommodate. She let us know there was a party in the back (which I understood) but made it clear she wouldn\'t help us so at that point I just gave up.\nThe food was good and our server was nice but other than that
column13: the interaction we had with her was unpleasant and ruined this place for us. Don\'t think we\'ll be returning.'

author: Paige DiFiore
text: 'SUCH a good time doing the $25 brunch with friends. Amazing portions and nice drinks
column5: too. The place is pretty and the service was amazing. Keep in mind the chicken in the chicken and waffles does have bones.'

author: Barak Nizgoda
text: 'This is my favorite bar in Hoboken
column5: they have a large selection of beers on tap and the best food
column6: but to mention the excellent service.'

author: Alejandra Limones
text: 'The ambience an the staff are amazing! The food and the cocktails are good!\n\nJust please made the meat of the tacos a little more tender! It was really hard to chew üò∞
column5: but the flavor was good.'

author: Ej Carannante
text: 'Great place for drinks and a good time'

text: 'Taco Tuesday is decent especially the pulled pork Taco. Very tasty cookie and ice cream dessert. Drinks are all pre-mixed and sugary but it gets the job done.'

text: 'Great place

author: Alexandra Raspanti
text: 'Really used to love coming here for a casual drink. Not sure what happened with the management here but it certainly has changed and is rather disappointing. Came with a friend on a Saturday night and we ordered food and a decent amount of drinks (not sure how much more we could have ordered) and we were rudely rushed out. I even mentioned that a stool was broken and was given an attitude. Not the right way to treat customers who are more than willing to spend. I didnt appreciate the attitude from the staff here and don‚Äôt think I will be returning unfortunately.'

author: J C
text: 'Eh.'

author: Diana Ruggiero
text: "The manage had terrible manners and was really unprofessional!!! I usually go here often but since the pandemic
column5: I haven't been out as much. Last night my friend and I decided to go out and try to enjoy ourselves. When the manager was looking at us weird the whole night. It truly made me feel very uncomfortable. My friend was standing next to me since people were standing up socializing real closely and she rushed over followed by a rude comment she made. I didn't appreciate it at all. Sad to say I won't be coming back until they have a new manager that's not rude or unprofessional. When someone is paying money to dine out they want a more pleasant experience. However she acted like trash."

author: V H
text:
'Soggy cow.

Food was good bar/southern food. Waiters had attitude.

Get the ribs not the brisket.'

text: 'Love this spot great food and drinks'

text: 'Love this place for Sunday football'

author: Marie Lopez
text: 'Bartender was great. The manager/server on duty was extremely rude and unprofessional.   You dont treat your employees that way especially in front of guests!!! . Really turned my whole experience off. Felt super uncomfortable.'

author: Jake Comito
text: 'Cool spot!\n\nThis brunch was exactly what I wanted after a night drinking. They had a GREAT brunch deal - $25 for two drinks
column5: a hearty meal
column6: and some bread and chocolatey oatmeal. The breakfast burger was great
column7: fries great and the oatmeal thingy was a treat for sure.'

author: Xauen Zirpolo
text: "A real gem in Hoboken. Most places that offer brunch have either an expensive prefix or a small selection; the Stewed Cow is a lovely exception. $25 gets you their brunch prefix with two drinks and a choice of entree; I got the Frankie's feast and it was delicious. Drinks are nicely sized and very tasty- the bloody mary was especially good
column5: just the right amount of everything. I always try and make a reservation on Open Table since they have limited outdoor seating. They're also very dog-friendly if you choose to bring your pet with you and sit outside."

author: Michael Tukhugov
text: 'Delicious food!!! Even if you go here just for the wings it will be worth it but get a churro while you are there. Great drink specials
column5: definitely try the season fall craft drinks
column6: the apple cider is wonderful. Carissa the manager made sure to introduce herself & check on us which is nice you dont see managers do that much anymore
column7: great service
column8: clean bathrooms! I would have given 5 stars but the stools are just terrible
column9: get a seat if you can or sit along the bench

author: Priscilla Langsworth
text: 'The manager seemed very condescending. There‚Äôs a different vibe from what it used to be like last year. Not worth returning. The energy was definitely off.  The staff was basically not present and our server seemed to be else where mentally.  I used to love this place and was excited to return but I will definitely not be returning.'

author: Andrew Price
text: "Great burger and great staff. I was so excited to try their burgers
column5: but it started to storm really hard and I took my food to go. The rain ate through the bag
column6: and my food went all over the sidewalk! I'm so grateful that there staff were really nice and made me another burger. The Southwestern burger itself was well worth the wait!"

text: "They're frequently out of the beers or whiskeys I like but I take that as it's a popular place with a good selection. The country music is always on point and it's a nice laid back place that's not too overly crowded like some of the Hoboken bars"

text: 'Great bar in hoboken. Lots of screens to watch sports and good selection of drafts. They also have some tasty cocktails. They were out of the mix for the bori but tried the mango unchained and it was great. Fun place to check out if you‚Äôre in the area.'

author: Manan Parikh
text: "Good pub
column5: bar in good neighborhood. They have opened their place in residential area
column6: so you can not expect loud music and dance. But they do have good music and bar tables. Wide variety of beers and different cocktail are great. Their bull ride opens after 8pm and it's something you can do with your frinds after some drinking

author: David Solomon
text: 'Tasty food and it came out quickly and the waitress did check up on us after we had received our meals. when we were all finished and had empty plates she had never came to clear the plates away
column5: another waiter came to clear everything up and asked us how we were doing. two ladies in our party got dessert and when they were finished we waited another twenty minutes later and our waitress had not been back to see if we were ready for the check. we had to flag her down for the check. pretty ridiculous for there to be an automatic tip of 20 percent for a party of 4 that had the check split in 2. Also when we got our receipt to sign
column6: the pen that we were given was from HRA HIV Prevention....nice...real classy and professional..'

text: 'Great place and great bartender'

author: Ariel Rech
text: 'I called at 12:15am on a Friday to ask if people were still riding the bull because my fiance and I wanted to get a drink and watch people attempt the bull. They said yes but that they would be shutting down the bull at 1am. We are a 10 minute walk away so we went thinking we would be able to watch a few people ride while we enjoyed a drink. We got there at 12:30am and they decided to shut down early and refused a group of well mannered guys who wanted to ride the bull. I was a little upset but we had just gotten our drinks so I decided that I would finish my drink and leave. Before 1am
column5: the bar decides that they don\'t want to stay open any longer
column6: even though they are supposed to stay open till 2am on Fridays and Saturdays. They yelled "last call" and then literally 5 minutes later they told everyone to get out. They started putting the chairs on the tables
column7: they turned on the super bright lights
column8: turned off the music and forced everyone to get out. I wasn\'t even half way through my drink and it wasn\'t even close to 2am yet. There was about 15 people in the bar so it wasn\'t that they wanted to close due to no customers. If your website says you are open till 2am
column9: you need to stay open till 2am instead of taking people\'s money
column11: and then shoving them out the door more than an hour before closing time.'

author: David Mallet
text: 'Good food
column5: especially brunch. Great recommendation for whiskey connoisseur.'

author: Andrea Ramirez
text: 'The mechanical bull was fun'

author: Jessica Boyer
text: 'Server did not seem to want to be there. Order was wrong. Food was not bad. Drinks kinda were.'

author: J B
text: "Amazing brunch spot! Such a great deal and we did not have to wait. Brunch comes with two drinks from an extensive list of options.  Coming from NYC

column5: to all my friends that where with me celebrate my birthday there. Don't go there.I will never go back there.The manager was mean to my boyfriend never giving him a chance to talk at all that rude for the manger. THE ONLY THING I LIKE WAS THE BULL THAT GUY WAS VERY NICE  TO ME."

text: 'This place was horrific. The servers and management were disrespectful

author: Sharlys Leszczuk
text: "The atmosphere here is so weird. We went and there was no one there. It made it awkward to be waited on by the bartender
column5: because everyone was hanging out as if there were no customers
column6: but we were there trying to enjoy a meal. The food was okay but with all the other great restaurants in Hoboken
column7: I probably won't return."

author: Frank C
text: "Very nice place. If you like whiskey and bourbon go here.  I went during the day and we had fun. I'm sure the mechanical bull can be fun at night. Food was good too. It did come out cold
column5: and yes I sent it back. I know

column7: right? But it tasted so much better hot.  I'll go back again."

author: Philippe Donaus
text: "The place has a chill vibe. It's not really a sports bar but you can watch a game if you would like. This place has a mechanical Bull but I'm unsure of when they let people actually ride it. 3 stars because the beer selection is high. They carry some local brews on tap
column5: other than that its a decent bar in Hoboken."

text: 'The cow was amazing'

author: James Clark
text: 'Amazing burgers'

text: 'Something different for the area. Great bourbon selection and BBQ dishes!'

author: Nick Lenzi
text: "Good burgers
column5:
good apps. Great little local corner spot. This is a go to spot for me when I need to have an evening meeting or to catch up with a friend. They have a ton of good apps.

The campfire nachos are so tasty. It's homemade potato chips covered in cheese and BBQ sauce with bacon and brisket. The loaded tots are also great.

I've had a bunch of their burgers. They are always cooked correctly and they are all good so go with what sounds good.

Also a big fan of their deviled eggs their custom salads.

Im not a big drinker but my friends always rave about their drinks. They even had hot mulled cider."

text: 'My friends and I were so excited to come here for a 25th birthday we were celebrating. Unfortunately
column5: we were very displeased. I cannot comment on the food
column6: the drinks
column7: the specials
column8: or anything else because my friends and I were not even acknowledged. Here we are
column9: a group of 6 and no one even greets us? The place wasn\'t really full
column11: there were employees behind the bar and some on the floor
column12: I believe. We weren\'t offered a menu
column15: not even a "hello" or "welcome".  Our anticipation of bull riding was very short lived. Needless to say
column16: after standing there for about 10 minutes with no one offering assistance we left

author: Agan Singh
text: 'Excellent brunch value. For $20 you get a muffin basket
column5: a great from the kitchen
column6: an entree and 2 drinks. I had the Cajun Slamon with greens
column7: potatoes and a biscuit and it was delicious'

author: Darold Delaney
text: 'Good for brunch
column5: not many healthy options on the brunch menu.'

author: Dan F.
text: 'Great bourbon selection
column5: decent beer selection
column6: and the food is good. Happy hour beer pricing on Monday is awesome
column7: but bourbon can get pricey unless doing the pre-selected flights on Wednesdays. Bartender was attentive and knowledgeable about all of the bourbon I tried

author: Vivian Phung
text: "It's pretty typical of a Hoboken bar. The mechanical bull gives it a nice unique touch."

author: Pat Coleman
text: 'Great burgers and wide selection of whiskey / bourbon keeps me coming back.'

author: Matthew Halper
text: 'Went there for drinks
column5: good night crowd.'

author: Jennilee Sepulveda
text: 'Great service and great atmosphere for a night out'

author: Lane Brettschneider
text: 'The food was incredible. It had to have been about a billion calories but boy
column5: was it worth it. The doughy chocolate chip cookie is unforgettable. The service was inconsistent
column6: however. The waitress asked us if we were doing okay WAY too many times while we were eating
column7: but then once our plates were empty
column8: no one took them away until they brought out the next course and there was no room.'

author: Kevin Tam
text: "The staff are friendly and welcoming. The food is good
column5: there's a good drink selection
column6: and the atmosphere is nice
column7: generally. It could get busy and noisy at times
column9: but I don't often spend much time inside as I normally get food to go from here."

author: Kyle Lukas
text: 'Love the bull riding
column5: nice change-up from the typical Hoboken bar scene.'

author: John Sama
text: 'Great staff. Brunch menu is solid.'

author: Jonny Dangerously
text: 'food was so so'

author: Ishil Patel
text: 'Great food. Drinks are good enough. Lively and excited football crown on Sundays.'

author: Mike P
text: 'Good selection'

author: Joseph Balady
text: 'Great burgers!'

author: Andrew Lewis
text: 'Alright for a cowboy bar.  Music kept changing genres.  No wait for bullriding through.'

author: JJ G
text: "I've only ever been for the brunch but holy cow (boom) it's a phenomenal deal. Killer food
column5: great drink options (bullit bacon bloody!?)
column6: and a comfortable atmosphere to hang out with friends."

author: Eugene Lanzaro
text: 'Nice place relax'

author: Stephanie Lanning
text: 'fun spot. love riding the bull. good drink specials and have always enjoyed the food'

author: Jarett Caparotta
text: 'Good beer selection
column5: pretty good food and a mechanical bull'

author: John Wright
text: 'Great food
column5: beer
column6: and atmosphere. I love ordering food from the Stewed Cow. They have one of the best brunches in town. I could not finish my plate and it comes with two drinks for $20.'

author: Heather Jimenez
text:
'(Translated by Google) Bulltastic.

(Original)
Bulltastic.'

author: Brian
text: 'Great bar with standard bar food and a mechanical bull. Also good whiskey selection'

author: Tom Koty
text: 'I love going to this place. Probably the best Old Fashioned in Hoboken and the bartenders really know their whiskeys
column5: bourbons
column6: and ryes. Great food too!'

author: Nicholas Casci
text: 'An American-only restaurant (with a couple Mexican tequilas). The barbecue is delicious and blow House of Que out of the water
column5: the bourbon and whisky selection is THE best in Hoboken
column6: music is always decent
column7: and they have a mechanical bull.'

author: Greg Whipple
text: 'Solid Hoboken bar. Never too crowded and good food and drink list'

author: Serg C
text: 'Great staff.  Great food. Great Whiskey selections. And large beer selection.'

author: Joe Pereira
text: 'Great atmosphere with great food and beverage.'

author: Elizabeth Markham
text: 'Great brunch special'

author: Pedro Franca
text: 'Great food great staff'

author: Alex Harding
text: 'Fun dive bar with decent food
column5: good drinks
column6: and a mechanical bull. Seriously
column7: go here for the mechanical bull.'

author: Andrew Stranovsky
text: "Nice bar off of the always busy Washington street.  Huge selection of burbon and a mechanical bull.  Can't go wrong with this place.  Brunches on the weekends are one of the better ones offered in Hoboken."

author: Craig Corbeels
text: "Cool spot. When I came here at around 11PM on a Saturday night it wasn't massively overcrowded
column5: they were playing good country music
column6: and everyone seemed friendly. They've got a long bar
column7: so getting a drink isn't too tough
column8: and the mechanical bull is a fun added bonus if you're feeling like it.\n\nAs for drinks
column9: they've got a fantastic selection of bourbon and whisky. They've got the staple beers as well as a few good crafts. I enjoyed it here and I'd make it a spot on my next night out. Especially if I'm with someone who hasn't ridden a mechanical bull before."

author: Ross Cohen
text: 'Lots of fun to be had.'

author: John Estrella Jr.
text: "This Saloon specializes in Bourbon and they have quite a selection.  Went on a Monday.  Half price SELECT appetizers.  We had the Spinach and Artichoke dip (1/2 off) and the Calamari (regular price).  Artichoke dip was pretty good
column5: but the calamari was absolutely amazing.  It's covered in buffalo sauce and comes with blue cheese on the side.  If you love buffalo wings
column6: you'll love this dish."

author: Stephanie Tom
text: "Hands down the best brunch in Hoboken. Formerly the Gaslight
column5: the Stewed Cow inherited the infamous $20 brunch that includes an entree
column6: some breakfast snacks like a plate of muffins
column7: fruit and oatmeal
column8: and two cocktails (choices include either a beer
column13: etc)! The brunch selections are all great
column15: but if you're feeling really decadent
column16: get the roadkill platter (but I'd suggest replacing scrambled eggs with sunnyside or over easy eggs because who doesn't love a runny yolk)."

author: Ruta P
text: "They wouldn't let us in at 130 am on a Friday night (The sign outside the door days no admittance after 2am). It was my best friends 30th birthday and instead of letting us in for one drink
column5: the bouncer called her spoiled for wanting to get in."

author: kevin levin
text: 'Best bar in Hoboken'

author: Piotr Rusinkiewicz
text: 'They have a good brunch special on both Saturdays and Sundays.  Been there a few times now and they put out good food even when the crowd is busy.  However
column5: the service was particularly slow on one occasion.'

author: Joe Blaschke
text: 'Great Bar'

author: Nathan James
text: 'Extremely good food. The meal and drinks were well-priced too. I will certainly be returning here.'

author: Tanisha S.
text: 'I stopped her for brunch.  $20 gets you an entree
column5: pastries
column6: fruit and 2 drinks.  I had their Western Omelet which was very yummy which came along with potatoes.  The staff was very attentive.  I loved their Sangria. I would definitely suggest stopping here.'

author: Tyler Lund
text: 'Grab a whiskey cocktail and hop up on the mechanical bull
column5: or just relax with friends at this popular Hoboken bar. A little off the beaten path in Hoboken
column6: this bar has a much calmer atmosphere than the typical Hoboken bar and is very popular with the locals. There were even several strollers parked inside during happy hour which is always a good sign in Hoboken. The libation menu features a huge bourbon list
column7: a good draught beer selection
column8: and some delicious cocktails that will help you work up the courage to ride the mechanical bull in the back. Even so
column9: it is far from a raucous crowd here
column10: even on a Friday at 11:30pm. I tried the bacon flavored "pork chops and appleasuce"
column11: probably my favorite drink of the night
column13: but with tequila instead of gin
column14: then the chocolate infused Cocoa old fashioned
column16: but very heavy. I also had the bacon
column18: and hot sauce burger which was incredible. The meat was excellently seasoned
column19: rare for bars in the area and the toppings mixed very well together. The fries were also very tasty. I also stole one of our friends\' bourbon wings which was very tasty and cooked well and nice and crispy.  Service was very good
column20: though because we started with only drinks
column21: they didn\'t come by incredibly often. The bartender suggested a whiskey for us and though I didn\'t love it
column22: I appreciated the knowledge of the products they had.'
